entry.title: Armenia not leaving Eurasian Economic Union, ministers say

media:group.media:title: Armenia not leaving Eurasian Economic Union, ministers say
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armenia's Economy Minister Gevorg Papoyan declared today that Armenia has no current plans to exit the Russian-led Eurasian Economic Union, while emphasizing that the country's potential EU membership pursuit would run parallel to existing commitments. ๐ Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan reimbursed roughly $19,000 to the municipal budget after controversy erupted over his business trip to Los Angeles in November, when taxpayer funds were used to purchase an expensive flight without conducting the required competitive bidding process for the contract.

entry.title: Armenia boosts tech sector with $80 million annual tax break package

media:group.media:title: Armenia boosts tech sector with $80 million annual tax break package
media:group.media:description:
๐ A senior Russian official warned Armenia that joining the European Union would be โincompatibleโ with staying in the Eurasian Economic Union. Armeniaโs economy remains highly dependent on Russia, and leaving the Kremlin-led bloc would have broad economic impacts for the country. ๐ A senior Armenian official said he expects local tech companies to keep about $80 million every year that would otherwise be taken as tax, after parliament passed a new package of tax breaks for the countryโs burgeoning IT sector.

media:group.media:title: ิณีตีธึีดึีซ. ีฝีบีธึีฟีซ ีธึ ีกีผีธีฒีปีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีด ีกีดีฅีถีกีฝีบีธึีฟีกีตีซีถ ึีกีฒีกึีธึีด
media:group.media:description:
ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีจ ยซีีฅีฎ ีฐีกึึีฅึยป ีญีธึีกีฃึีธีพ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีดีถีฅึีซ ีทีกึึ ีง ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีถีธึีด, ีธึีธีถึีซึ ีฅึึีธึีคีจ ีฟีฅีฒีซ ีง ีธึีถีฅึีฅีฌ ีคีฅีฏีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 19-ีซีถ ิณีตีธึีดึีซีธึีดี ยซีีบีธึีฟ ึ ีกีผีธีฒีปีธึีฉีตีธึีถยป ีฉีฅีดีกีตีธีพึ ีีถีถีกึีฏีธึีดีจ ีพีกึีธึีด ีง reึarrange ึีธีคึีกีฝีฟีซ ีฐีซีดีถีกีคีซึ ีีกึีฅีฏ ิฑีดีซึีญีกีถีตีกีถีจึ
ยซีีฅีฎ ีฐีกึึีฅึยป ีทีกึึีซ ีฅึึีธึีค ีฐีกีถีคีซีบีดีกีถ ีฉีฅีดีกีถ ีง ยซีีบีธึีฟ ึ ีกีผีธีฒีปีธึีฉีตีธึีถยปึ ีีตีธึึีฅึีถ ีฅีถี ีฎีกีถึีธึีค, ีกีทีญีกึีฐีซ ีนีฅีดีบีซีธีถ, ิตีพึีธีบีกีตีซ ีฏึีฏีถีกีฏีซ ีนีฅีดีบีซีธีถ ีีกีฆีซีฏ ิฑีพีคีกีฌีตีกีถีจ, ีฌีธีฒีธึีค ีีกึีฝีฅีถีซีฏ ีีกีถีธึีนีกึีตีกีถีจ, ีฐีธึีถีกีฐีผีธีดีฅีกีฏีกีถ ีธีณีซ ีจีดีขีทีกีดีกึีฟีซ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฐีกีพีกึีกีฏีกีถีซ ีดีกึีฆีซีน ิณึีธึีฃ ิฑีฌีฅึีฝีกีถีตีกีถีจ, ิฑีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ิบีธีฒีธีพีซ ยซีีกีฒีกึีกึีซีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีฃีซึยป ีญีดีขีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกีฟีฃีกีดีกีพีธึ ิฑึีฝีฅีถ ินีธึีธีฝีตีกีถีจ, ีฝึีฟีกีขีกีถ-ีกีผีซีฉีดีธีฌีธีฃ ีีกีฉึีซีฏ ีีธีพีกีฏีซีดีตีกีถีจ ึ ีีซึีกีฏีซ ีดีกึีฆีบีฅีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีกีทีญีกีฟีกีฏีกีฆีดีซ ิฟึีฉีธึีฉีตีกีถ, ีดีทีกีฏีธึีตีฉีซ ึ ีฝีบีธึีฟีซ ีพีกึีนีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฃีฌีญีกีพีธึ ีดีกีฝีถีกีฃีฅีฟ, ีฝีบีธึีฟีซ ีพีกีฝีฟีกีฏีกีพีธึ ีฃีธึีฎีซีน ีีกีนีกีฃีกีถ ีีกึีคีกีถีตีกีถีจึ

entry.title: Armenia rejects Aliyevโs โWestern Azerbaijanโ rhetoric

media:group.media:title: Armenia rejects Aliyevโs โWestern Azerbaijanโ rhetoric
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan outlined Armenia's position on territorial definitions, refugee rights, and a 12-point roadmap for regional peace, while firmly rejecting Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev's "Western Azerbaijan" narrative as a threat to Armenia's territorial integrity. ๐ In a press conference, Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan also touched upon Azerbaijanโs narrative of โWestern Azerbaijanโ that he described as a direct territorial demand on Armenia, also calling the concept of Zangezur Corridor unacceptable. ๐ Armeniaโs government approved and submitted to parliament a bill initiating the process of accession to the European Union.
